page.title: 17Redlynch in the past
page.content: Redlynch probably means "red clay". The area now known as Redlynch is identified on early maps as East Downton.The field opposite the school was the site of the village green, called Warminster Green until it became subject to an enclosure act. Earlier this century much of the village population worked on the Newhouse and Hamptworth Lodge estates as domestic staff, coachmen, grooms, gardeners, woodmen and copsers. In the village were several besom makers, making both heather and birch brooms. Bessomer Drove was the home of some of the besom makers. Faggot tying provided work mainly for women.The faggots were delivered to bakers and private homes. Farm labourers worked long hours some travelling as far as Chichester for the harvest and sleeping in barns.
